definition: to mix with others/to socialize/to deal with/to contend
to make a circuit/to circle/circle/circumference/lap/cycle/complete/all/all over/thorough/to help financially

sentences.english: I am due for a talking-to after my little bout with the drug store police this morning.

sentences.english: Spies use sex, intelligence, and the thrill of a secret life as bait.
sentences.chinese: 間諜運用美色與智慧，周旋其中，擔當魚餌。

sentences.english: But he needed immense patience to deal with Cairo’s bureaucracy.
sentences.chinese: 然而他需要巨大的毅力去和開羅的官員周旋。

sentences.chinese: 你們必須耐心和巴西隊周旋到底’。

sentences.english: There is the problem of Buggin's turn, an expectation that the award should rotate between regions of the world.
sentences.chinese: 但問題是籌委會的希望和平獎在各大洲之間周旋。

sentences.english: The hostess circulated among her guests.
sentences.chinese: 女主人周旋於賓客之間。

sentences.english: 2299 – In France, guerrilla movement against Islam.

sentences.english: One of the hostess's duties is to mingle with the guests.

sentences.english: Pig and the old sand, you are here dealing with her, I save the Master.
sentences.chinese: 八戒，老沙，你們在這裏和她周旋，我去救師父。

sentences.english: Subsequently, the police to arrange these father and the expansion.
sentences.chinese: 隨後，警方安排小思的父親與綁匪展開周旋。

sentences.english: This tug is apparent in the whole movement of expatriation.
sentences.chinese: 這種兩面周旋的態度在整個寄居海外運動中極爲明顯。

sentences.english: A swashbuckler who uses agility and guile to stand toe-to-toe with enemies.
sentences.chinese: 一個用敏捷和貼身技能去與敵人周旋的俠客。

sentences.english: Deal with the gossipy neighbors and trivial issues that happen on the street?

sentences.english: Penguin Generals always win in a battle of wits .
sentences.chinese: 企鵝將軍始終贏得鬥智周旋。

sentences.english: A penny less and you're on your own in the labyrinth.
sentences.chinese: 少掏一分錢，那你還是繼續在官僚主義中周旋去吧。

definition: to get away/to escape (from obligations)/to free oneself/to disengage
to be in a tangle/to nag
(idiom) terribly busy/up to one's ears in work
to wait for an opportunity/to watch for one's chance
to lobby/to campaign/to promote (an idea, a product)/(old) to visit various rulers and promote one's political ideas (in the Warring States period)
to control/to curb/to restrict/to impede/to pin down (enemy troops)
to escape unscathed/to get through in one piece
to fight or argue on a blogging site (netspeak)
